page.title: 15PICK YOUR OWN FRUIT
page.content: The Oxford "Pick_your_own" fruit farm embodies a typical 20th century idea in harvesting. Instead of the farmer paying for labour to pick the fruit and vegetables, the public are invited to pick the produce themselves. This means that the "middle_man's" profit is cut out, and people know that they are getting the pick of the crop at a reasonable price. In the soft_fruit season whole families come out and pick the produce for home_freezing and jam_making. It is weighed and paid for on the spot. Fruit grown includes strawberries, raspberries,blackcurrants and gooseberries. Vegetables grown are spinach, runner beans, courgettes, onions and potatoes. Volunteers from the church in Elsfield run a tea stall to raise money for the church funds.
